result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rafiq T Borders

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rafiq T Borders in court.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Rafiq T Borders.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is still awaiting a DPA agreement from the State and requests a DPA hearing date. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rafiq T Borders in court.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Rafiq T Borders.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Parties are continuing negotiations surrounding a DPA resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rafiq T Borders in court.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Rafiq T Borders.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised Court that case may resolve with DPA.  Court will allow additional time for state to see if defendant is eligible for DPA.  Case adjourned, Br. 13.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rafiq T Borders in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rafiq T Borders appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel informed the Court of potential negotiation with the State and requests additional time. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Rafiq T Borders in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rafiq T Borders appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense informed the court that additional discovery was requested from defendant's related cases.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Rafiq T Borders in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and waiting for an offer and requests an adjournment.  
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Defendant Rafiq T Borders in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 2:30p
